instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on 20 seconds, then turn off and no more on
threads.message:
I replaced the gpu in <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, I tested many hours with valley benchmark, shipped it back to customer. Customer went to Apple Store to mount HDD and then called me the same day because macbook doesn't turn on.
I received macbook back:

No visible damage on the board, if I try to turn it on multiple times plugging magsafe to board, sometimes it turns on and I get video on lcd, after 20 second it shut down.
I thinks there are no short in power rails because sometimes it turn on. Could be SMC o <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> or gpu? what can cause shut down after 20 seconds?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on 20 seconds, then turn off and no more on
threads.message: i reflowed SMC and now it works. My question now is? Is reflow of SMC a temporary fix like gpu Or is SMC a real solder problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on 20 seconds, then turn off and no more on
threads.message: This could have been anything. It could really have been an SMC issue or something else got heated up and works again. Expect another return on this....
